com.compactcode
Class FluentList<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.google.common.collect.ForwardingObject
      com.google.common.collect.ForwardingCollection<E>
          com.google.common.collect.ForwardingList<T>
              com.compactcode.FluentList<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<T>, Collection<T>, List<T>
public class FluentList<T>
extends ForwardingList<T>

A list that provides a convenient, fluent way of interacting with the google collections api.

expand

public <O> FluentList<O> expand(Function<T,List<O>> expander)
Convert each element of this list into a list, then concatenate those lists. Lazy transformation is not supported during expand, defaults to immediate in this case.

immediate

public FluentList<T> immediate()
Subsequent transformations (map, transform) will be applied using a ImmediateListStrategy. This is the default behaviour.

lazy

public FluentList<T> lazy()
Subsequent transformations (map, transform) will be applied using a LazyListStrategy.

parallel

Subsequent transformations (map, transform) will be applied using a ParallelListStrategy.
